title: Type 1 Diabetes Cure: Stem Cell Therapy Shows Promise in Trials
introText: Stem cell therapy has effectively cured Type 1 diabetes in clinical trials, eliminating the need for insulin injections in treated patients. The breakthrough could free millions from daily diabetes management.

content.content: Patients receiving stem cell-derived insulin-producing cells achieved normal blood sugar levels without insulin injections. After one year, 80% remained insulin-independent.
Stem cells are programmed to become insulin-producing beta cells, then implanted in patients. The cells respond to blood sugar levels naturally, eliminating the need for external insulin.
Larger trials are underway with FDA fast-track designation. If successful, the treatment could be available by 2027 for the 1.6 million Americans with Type 1 diabetes.
